bibliographic-data.invention-title: Syndication Loan Administration and Processing System

nplcit.text: Rutter, J., "Deals in Cyberspace", Euromoney, London, Feb. 1998
"Cyber street", Wall Street and Technology, New York, June, 1997
Corporate EFT Report "lnternet promises lower cost loan syndications IntraLink replaces paper with online access" Nov. 12,1997, V17, IS21, Phillips Business Information
CFO Alert "New medium brewing for syndications" March 23, 1998, V5, N121 ISSN: 0894-4822

abstract.p: A loan syndication tracking and management system and method provides a user with access to specific details related to a syndicated loan. The system and method coordinates investor, borrower and resource information, in addition to features related to the overall structure of a syndicated loan. Users access the system with various levels of permissions to view, add, update or delete information according to their allotted permissions. The system permits multiple users to access the information for efficient handling of approvals and requests related to multiple investors and borrowers, in addition to handling institution interchanges and notifications. The system and method keeps a record of all transactions and changes for review, reporting or regulatory purposes. The administration of a syndicated loan transaction is simplified while providing advanced features such as support for loan trading.

abstract.p: A loan syndication tracking and management system and method provides a user with access to specific details related to a syndicated loan. The system and method coordinates investor, borrower and resource information, in addition to features related to the overall structure of a syndicated loan. Users access the system with various levels of permissions to view, add, update or delete information according to their allotted permissions. The system permits multiple users to access the information for efficient handling of approvals and requests related to multiple investors and borrowers, in addition to handling institution interchanges and notifications. The system and method keeps a record of all transactions and changes for review, reporting or regulatory purposes.
The administration of a syndicated loan transaction is simplified while providing advanced features such as support for loan trading.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYNDICATION LOAN ADMINISTRATION AND PROCESSING SYSTEM
SYSTEME DE TRAITEMENT ET D'ADMINISTRATION DE CREDIT SYNDIQUE

abstract.p: A loan syndication tracking and management system and method provides a user with access to specific details related to a syndicated loan. An individual user typically accesses the system through a user interface(10). User interface(10) is preferably connected to an application server(20) and a reports server(22), each of which are accessible by the user. Application server(20) preferably has access to a number of resources including a network file server(12) an SNA gateway(14) and a fax server(16)

Network file server(12) hosts network accessible files and has a large number of resources available to the Local Area Network with user access of the system with various levels of permissions to view , add, update or delete information according to their allotted permissions. The system coordinates investor, borrower and resource information, in addition to features related to the overall structure of a syndicated loan

permits multiple users to access the information for efficient handling of approvals and request related to multiple investors and borrowers, in addition to handling institution interchanges and notifications and keeps a record of all transactions and changes for review, reporting or regulatory purposes.

L'invention concerne un système et un procédé de gestion et de suivi de crédit syndical permettant à un utilisateur d'avoir accès à des détails spécifiques concernant un crédit syndiqué. Un utilisateur individuel accède généralement au système via une interface utilisateur (10). Celle-ci (10) est, de préférence, reliée à un serveur d'applications 20 et un serveur de rapports (22), ces deux serveurs étant accessibles par l'utilisateur. Un serveur d'applications (20) comprend, de préférence, un accès à un certain nombre de ressources, notamment un serveur de fichiers de réseau (12), une passerelle SNA (14) et un serveur de télécopies.

Un serveur de fichiers de réseau (12) héberge les fichiers qui sont accessibles par le réseau et présente un nombre important de ressources disponibles sur le réseau local et accessibles au moyen d'un accès utilisateur du système, comprenant plusieurs niveaux d'autorisations relatives à la visualisation, l'ajout, la mise à jour ou l'élimination des informations en fonction des autorisations attribuées à l'utilisateur. Le système coordonne l'investisseur, l'emprunteur et les informations relatives aux ressources ainsi que les caractéristiques relatives à la structure générale d'un crédit syndiqué.

Ce système permet non seulement à plusieurs utilisateurs d'avoir accès aux informations en vue d'un traitement efficace d'approbations et de demandes relatives aux investisseurs et emprunteurs multiples, mais aussi de gérer des échanges d'informations et des notifications entre des institutions et de conserver un dossier de toutes les transactions et échanges à des fins de révision, de rapport ou de règlement.
